concise_definition: adj. 强迫的, 强制的; v. 强迫, 强行 (force 的现在分词)

definitions.explanation_en: Describing an action, argument, or situation that is imposed in a way that feels unnatural, pressured, or lacking in sincerity or logical coherence.
definitions.explanation_cn: 形容一种被强加的行为、论点或情境，感觉不自然、带有压力，或缺乏真诚与逻辑连贯性。
definitions.example_en: His apology seemed forcing and insincere, as if he was just trying to avoid punishment.
definitions.example_cn: 他的道歉显得勉强而不真诚，仿佛只是为了逃避惩罚。

definitions.explanation_en: To make someone do something against their will or better judgment, often through pressure, threats, or manipulation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过压力、威胁或操纵，迫使某人做违背其意愿或判断的事情。
definitions.example_en: They were forcing the villagers to leave their homes for the new dam project.
definitions.example_cn: 他们强迫村民为新建水坝工程离开家园。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause something to happen prematurely or unnaturally, often by applying external pressure or influence.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过施加外部压力或影响，使某事过早或不自然地发生。
definitions.example_en: The coach was forcing the young player to return to the game before he was fully recovered.
definitions.example_cn: 教练强迫这位年轻球员在尚未完全康复前就重返赛场。

comparison.analysis: “Compelling” (令人信服的/有说服力的) 指通过逻辑、情感或魅力使人自愿接受或行动，虽有压力感但不具强制性。而 “forcing” 强调的是外力施压、违背意愿，常带有负面色彩。
“Coercing” (胁迫) 与 “forcing” 非常接近，都指通过威胁或暴力手段迫使他人行动。但 “coercing” 更常用于法律或政治语境，强调系统性或制度性的压迫，而 “forcing” 用法更广泛，可涵盖日常语境中的心理或情感压力。
“Imposing” (强加的) 指将某种观点、规则或行为强加于人，但不一定涉及直接的胁迫或暴力，更多是权威或地位上的压制。而 “forcing” 更强调行动上的强制执行，常伴随抵抗或冲突。
